definition: to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
lit. not to shed a tear until one sees the coffin (idiom)/fig. refuse to be convinced until one is faced with grim reality
pinyin: bu4 jian4 guan1 cai5 bu4 luo4 lei4

sentences.english: Watching, I was moved almost to tears.
sentences.chinese: 此情此景让我感动得几乎落泪。

sentences.english: However, Lin Zengxian was moved to tears in a recent press conference.
sentences.chinese: 不过林增祥日前在记者会上激动落泪。

sentences.english: I don’t want often to shed tears over that.
Have adamancy, the person that never weeps ?
sentences.chinese: 有坚强，从不落泪的人吗？

sentences.english: The audience were greatly impressed and many of them moved to tears.
sentences.chinese: 在场观众深受感染，有人不禁落泪。

sentences.english: If you shed your tears when you miss the sun, you also miss the stars.
sentences.chinese: 如果你因错过太阳而落泪，那么你也会错过群星了。

sentences.english: Small Hei Yang lives ovine life, often sad weep.
sentences.chinese: 小黑羊过着寄人篱下的日子，经常伤心落泪。

sentences.english: The doctor who had been used to see separation and death burst into tears at that moment.
sentences.chinese: 看惯了生离死别的医生，却在这一刻落泪了。

sentences.english: Looking at this pathetic scene, her heart broke. Weeping, she urged Tzu-chuan to wash Tai-yu quickly.
sentences.chinese: 李纨目睹惨状，心酸落泪，忙催着紫鹃快给黛玉擦洗。

sentences.english: Don't cry bacause it is over, smile bacause it happened.
sentences.chinese: 不要因为爱而伤心落泪，曾经拥有才是最重要。

sentences.english: Thusly , their short period of existence is enough to bring tears to our eyes.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，她们的存在时间，更是短得令人落泪。

sentences.english: She wept in the privacy of her own room.
sentences.chinese: 她在自己房内暗暗落泪。

sentences.english: Thousands of Miss Miriam said Liang Bing wedding, due to China to see the stars of my colleagues and feelings tears.
sentences.chinese: 千嬅表示在梁炳婚宴上，因见到华星同事而感触落泪。

sentences.english: He was weeping sorrowfully when leaving his hometown.
sentences.chinese: 离开家乡时，他伤心地落泪了。

sentences.english: Edwinmcconkey mother saw grandson love dearly straight after the tears, she missed a grandson.
sentences.chinese: 康凯妈妈看到孙子后心疼地直落泪，她太想念孙子了。

sentences.english: They come to StoryCorps to cry and talk about what happened on that day.
sentences.chinese: 他们追忆那天发生的一切，伤心落泪。

definition: eyes brimming with tears of excitement (idiom)/extremely moved
to choke with emotion/to choke with sobs
to bury one's head in one's hands and weep (idiom)
to get excited/passionate/aroused to passion/to fall in love/on heat (of animals)
